page.title: 04LAND OWNERSHIP AND VALUE.
page.content: We are working in an area of twelve squares,{11.5}of which the Duke of Northumberland owns.He does not own some parts of Lesbury and Hipsburn villages.1 square on our map=1 sq.km. We estimated how much the Duke would receive if he sold our block.To buy one acre of agricultural land today would cost approximately{Â£1500.}There are 2.471 acres to one hectare,and one hundred hectares in one sq.km. Therefore there are 247.1 acres in one hectare.There are 11.5 squares,so in our area there are 2841.7 acres. Since each acre costs Â£1500 in all the Duke would receive{about Â£4 262 550}for his land.He also owns the minerals under his land.
